177.title: Charges framed against Sanjay Singh in UP over 2008 protest
177.article_body: A local court in UP framed charges against 14 people including AAP MP Sanjay Singh and former SP MLA Anoop Sanda in connection with a street protest against the power department in 2008. The demonstration had reportedly led to a traffic jam with the agitators blocking the road. Earlier in 2008, a case was registered against 36 people.

178.title: NASA's Artemis l mission faces weeks of delay after launch scrubbed
178.article_body: NASA's Artemis l mission's launch could be delayed by at least several weeks after two scrubbed launch attempts. The officials said they will likely have to roll the SLS rocket back to its assembly building to make repairs. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson said if the rollback happens, a new attempt to launch the mission may not happen until mid-October.

179.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant loses external power again: IAEA
179.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant lost external power again, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). A reserve line continued to supply electricity to the grid. Only one of the six reactors remained operational, the IAEA added. Europe's largest nuclear power plant has been witnessing shelling with Russians and Ukrainians blaming each other.

180.title: Maha tribal woman gives birth in bedsheet on way to hospital, loses baby
180.article_body: A 32-year-old tribal woman in labour was carried to a hospital in a bedsheet due to lack of roads in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. The woman gave birth on the way but the baby passed away before reaching the health centre which is 1.5 km away from the village. As per villagers, health department staff visited her next day for post-delivery treatment.

181.title: I roped in a Kashmiri tutor for diction: Aparshakti on 'Dhokha...'
181.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana, who will play a Kashmiri terrorist in the film 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', said that getting the character's diction right was important for him. "Kashmiris have a different accent that is unique to them...I roped in a Kashmiri tutor to keep it more authentic," he added. The film also features R Madhavan and Darshan Kumaar.

182.title: Moosewala's parents still getting threats, Punjab govt a failure: Congress
182.article_body: Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Punjab Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa criticised Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government and said that the Punjab government is "failure" in managing law and order in state. The Congress leader said that Sidhu Moosewala's father is still receiving threats from gangsters and it appears that the tall claims of the Punjab government were completely hollow.

183.title: India should show more generosity: Hasina on water-sharing dispute
183.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina while commenting on the India-Bangladesh water-sharing dispute told ANI, "We're downstream, water is coming from India. So, India should show more generosity." Calling it a "long-standing problem", she said that the dispute should be resolved. "We found that [PM Narendra Modi] is very eager to solve this but the problem is in your country," she added.

184.title: UP man gives wife triple talaq for gaining weight after marriage
184.article_body: A 28-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has alleged that her husband gave her triple talaq as she gained weight after marriage. In a police complaint, Nazma Begum claimed that her husband taunted and tortured her, and kicked her out of the house. The couple, married for about eight years, has a seven-year-old son.

185.title: Scammer pretends to be Nikhil Chinapa, asks for money from others
185.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa on Sunday took to Twitter to share screenshots of a WhatsApp chat of a scammer who was pretending to be him and asking for money from others. "People I follow on Instagram and who also have a business account are getting messages for money, from a scammer pretending to be me," Chinapa tweeted.

186.title: J&K people will decide name of my party, flag; will be a Hindustani name: Azad
186.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, who resigned from the party recently, held a public meeting in Jammu on Sunday. Azad said he will launch a new party soon, adding, "I've not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party. I'll give a Hindustani name."

187.title: Gulf countries financing 'love jihad' in India: Gujarat BJP MLA
187.article_body: Gujarat BJP MLA Shashikant Pandya in a press conference said that the Gulf countries are financing 'love jihad' in India. The MLA said that those countries provide funds to Muslim clerics in India for the purpose. Notably, various groups held protests in Deesa on Saturday over the conversion of three members of a Hindu family.

188.title: Ali Anwar seeks opposition support for welfare of Pasmanda Muslims
188.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar and chief of All India Pasmanda Muslim Mahaz wrote a letter to the opposition parties, seeking support for the welfare and development of Pasmanda Muslims and other backward communities. “Pasmanda is not just a vote bank, but it is a part of the fight for social justice and equality,” said Anwar.

189.title: It's awkward, think I'm gonna die: BTS' RM on sending message to fans from airport
189.article_body: K-pop boy and BTS' leader RM was spotted at Seoul's Gimpo Airport on his way to Tokyo on Saturday when a member of the media asked him to send a message to fans. RM said, "It's so awkward I think I'm gonna die...It's my 10th year since my debut and it's really awkward. I'll go and come back safely."

190.title: Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances: Shah
190.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the view with which jails are seen in society needs to be changed. Speaking at the inauguration of the 6th All India Prison Duty Meet in Ahmedabad, Shah added, "Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances which force their involvement."

191.title: 4 Afghan kids playing with unexploded shell killed after it detonates
191.article_body: Four children were killed after an unexploded shell detonated when they started playing with it in their school in Afghanistan's Helmand, police and a doctor said. The children had discovered the ordnance and brought it inside the school, as per a statement by the provincial police chief's office. Three other children were also injured in the incident, the statement added.

192.title: Thousands evacuated as wildfire burns 4,000 acres of land in US
192.article_body: Thousands of residents were evacuated after a rapidly spreading wildfire burnt about 4,000 acres of land in US' California. According to authorities and officials, about 100 houses were destroyed and two people were injured in the wildfire. Moreover, California Governor Gavin Newsom has proclaimed a state of emergency for Siskiyou County. The wildfire had started on Friday.

193.title: China's top legislator to visit Russia for Eastern Economic Forum
193.article_body: China's top legislator Li Zhanshu is all set to attend the seventh Eastern Economic Forum in the Russian city of Vladivostok, official Xinhua news agency reported. Li, chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee, will be the most senior Chinese official to visit Russia since the country invaded Ukraine. He will also visit Mongolia, South Korea and Nepal.

194.title: Govt shouldn't run businesses as firms run by them aren't efficient: Maruti Chairman
194.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava said the government shouldn't be running businesses as companies run by them "aren't efficient". He added, "[The companies] don't have productivity. They don't generate profit…They need government support all the time to grow." He added, "For most capital investments they need...funds from the government. You can't have industrial growth from taxation".

195.title: Neetu shares pic with Rishi Kapoor on late actor's birth anniversary
195.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture with her late husband and actor Rishi Kapoor on his 70th birth anniversary on Sunday. Along with the picture, the 'JugJugg Jeeyo' actress wrote, "Happy birthday." Several celebrities, including Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karan Kundrra, reacted to the post. Kareena commented, "Happy birthday, Chintu uncle."

196.title: Be the Union Home Minister: Chidambaram on Narottam's remark
196.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra over “sleeper cells” remark and asked him to be the Union Home Minister if he has more information than Amit Shah. “The MHA once said that the government had no information on the tukde-tukde gang… If Mishra has the information then he should become the Union Home Minister,” said Chidambaram.

197.title: 'We lost ₹225 crore in a day to floods,' say Bengaluru-based IT and banking firms
197.article_body: Bengaluru-based major IT and banking companies collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road on August 30 as their staff were stuck for more than 5 hours, the organisation representing the companies said. The organisation has urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to address infrastructure issues in the city, saying, "Inadequate infrastructure...has now reached a crisis level."

198.title: Look who's grown up and a mother now: Arjun pens note for Sonam
198.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor on Saturday took to social media to share a picture with his cousin actress Sonam Kapoor. The actor wrote alongside the picture, "Look Who's all grown up & is a mother now !!! OMG it's you @sonamkapoor." Sonam welcomed her baby boy on August 20 with her husband fashion entrepreneur Anand Ahuja.

199.title: Halla Bol rally marks the season 5 of 'Rahul Relaunch': BJP
199.article_body: The BJP criticised Congress’ Halla Bol rally and called it an event to relaunch MP Rahul Gandhi. BJP Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted that the Halla Bol rally is the fifth attempt of the Party to relaunch Rahul Gandhi. “NASA has contacted Congress to ask it how they managed to relaunch a failed rocket again & again,” said Poonawalla.

200.title: Cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops can't be considered 'ganja': Bombay HC
200.article_body: The Bombay High Court while granting pre-arrest bail to a man accused of possessing commercial quantity of narcotic substance ruled that a seized cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops does not fall under the purview of 'ganja'. The court was hearing the pre-arrest bail plea filed by Kunal Kadu, who was apprehended arrest by the NCB under NDPS Act.

201.title: Kohli should see till T20 WC 2022 whether T20 cricket suits him: Akhtar
201.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he would suggest Virat Kohli to evaluate till T20 World Cup 2022 whether T20 cricket "suits" him. "Kohli's both innings [in Asia Cup so far] were quite patchy," added Akhtar. "When he plays...the longer formats, Kohli will get time to settle," he stated. "I...want him to score...100 centuries and break Sachin Tendulkar's record," said Akhtar.

202.title: China reports 1,848 COVID cases, Shenzhen under weekend lockdown
202.article_body: Mainland China recorded 1,848 new COVID-19 cases on September 3 with 384 symptomatic cases, according to the National Health Commission. The country recorded 1,988 new cases a day earlier, with 502 symptomatic cases. Most residents in the southern technology hub of Shenzhen went into a weekend lockdown on Saturday as authorities began mass COVID-19 testing.

203.title: Changing name of AIIMS would lead to loss of identity: Faculty body
203.article_body: Changing the name of AIIMS would result in a loss of identity of the institution, said Faculty Association of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (FAIMS). In a letter to its members, the association expressed concern over speculations that AIIMS could be named after some famous personality, leader or a freedom fighter. "Identity is linked with the name," it said.

204.title: I don't expect Rishabh Pant to play against Pakistan: Wasim Jaffer
204.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he doesn't expect Rishabh Pant to be picked for the upcoming match against Pakistan, considering the presence of Dinesh Karthik. Pant wasn't selected for the previous game against the same opposition as well. Discussing the upcoming match against Pakistan, Jaffer stated, "We haven't played the brand of cricket we discuss, that aggressive approach [against them]."

205.title: Hasina thanks PM Modi for evacuating Bangladeshi students amid Ukraine war
205.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina thanked PM Narendra Modi for evacuating students of her country amid the war between Ukraine and Russia. "Many of our students were just stuck and they came to Poland [for] shelter. But when you [evacuated Indian] students...they also brought our students back home," she said. She also thanked PM Modi for contributing COVID-19 vaccines to Bangladesh.

206.title: Psychologist sexually harasses female students in Hyderabad, jailed
206.article_body: A Hyderabad-based psychologist was sentenced to 16 days of imprisonment for harassing and making sexual advances towards female students online. The accused conducted counselling sessions in institutions and gave his number under the pretext of sending motivational quotes. However, when students contacted him, he'd harass them and share graphic images in an attempt to coerce them into a sex chat.

207.title: Cong workers gather for Halla bol rally, Delhi police say no one detained
207.article_body: A huge crowd of supporters of the Indian National Congress, on Sunday, gathered at the Ramlila Maidan in Delhi for the 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally. The Delhi Congress took to Twitter to share a video of the crowd. Meanwhile, Hemant Tiwari, Additional DCP of Delhi Police denied the reports of Congress workers being detained.

208.title: 3 booked for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi gang, extorting money from farmer
208.article_body: A man and his two sons have been booked for allegedly posing as Lawrence Bishnoi's gang members and extorting ₹50 lakh from a farmer in Haryana. The victim told police the accused were aware he recently received ₹75 lakh as compensation for giving his land for a railway line project. He said accused threatened to murder him like Sidhu Moosewala.

209.title: The Weeknd ends concert abruptly mid-song after 'losing voice'; releases statement
209.article_body: The Weeknd's concert at Los Angeles' SoFi Stadium was cancelled abruptly on Saturday. "I don't know what just happened...I just lost my voice [mid-song], this is killing me...but I can't give you the concert," he told the crowd. He apologised in a statement and said, "I felt it (voice) go and my heart dropped. My deepest apologies to my fans."

210.title: Firoz Nadiadwala in talks with Anand Pandit for Hera Pheri 3: Report
210.article_body: Film producer Firoz Nadiadwala is in talks with producer Anand Pandit to revive the third instalment of the 2000 film 'Hera Pheri'. "The two have been discussing all the possible...combinations to bring...Raju, Shyam and Baburao back together, however, the things are not there on paper yet," a source revealed. The 2000 film featured Akshay Kumar, Paresh Rawal and Suniel Shetty.

211.title: 26-yr-old MP woman sets self on fire after police refuse to file rape case
211.article_body: A 26-year-old woman set herself on fire at a police station in Madhya Pradesh on Friday, officials said. She had gone to the police station to lodge rape case against a revenue officer. The woman alleged that police did not accept her complaint and advised her to "settle matter outside". The revenue officer was also present at the police station.

212.title: Illness behind 54% of suicides reported in Ludhiana in 2021: NCRB report
212.article_body: National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) released a report stating illness is the main reason behind suicide by at least 192 people, including 146 men and 46 women, in 2021 in Ludhiana. This accounts for 54% of total suicides reported in the year. In 2021, 307 people, including 71 women, committed suicide in Ludhiana which is 13.5% less compared to 2020.

213.title: 'Did I rape her?' says Karnataka BJP MLA on being questioned over threatening a woman
213.article_body: When a reporter asked Karnataka BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali why he threatened a woman activist in public, Limbavali said, "You are speaking in favour of women. Speak in favour of the people...What have I done? Have I raped her?" A video showed Limbavali shouting at and threatening the woman, who was protesting against the demolition of her property in Bengaluru.

214.title: Who am I to save anyone?: Chhattisgarh CM on housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur
214.article_body: Reacting to question of housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur to save Hemant Soren-led Jharkhand government, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said, "Who am I to save anyone (state govt)?" "They are guests in my state," he added. Earlier on Friday Baghel said that his state will soon witness Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax (I-T) department raids.

215.title: Two transgender men allegedly harassed, thrashed in Gurugram
215.article_body: Two transgender men who are board members of an NGO were allegedly harassed and beaten up by a man dressed as a policeman in Gurugram. As per their complaint, the man was the father of another transgender man who had taken up voluntary residence at their shelter home in July. The accused allegedly took them to a police station.

216.title: I went through 'tough moments': Nadal on win in US Open 3rd round
216.article_body: Four-time champion Rafael Nadal has now entered the fourth round of US Open, following a 6-0, 6-1, 7-5 win against Frenchman Richard Gasquet. Nadal remains unbeaten against Gasquet having won his 18th match against the latter. "[The] third set (was) a challenge. He increased the level...I went through...difficult moments," said Nadal. "I need to keep going," he added.

217.title: India will be second largest economy in world by 2047: Commerce Secy
217.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Saturday that India will be among the top four economies globally within a few years and the second largest economy in the world by 2047. "There was a time when India had a share of 25% of the world economy. The way India is growing, we will regain the same position," he said.

218.title: Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim retires from T20I cricket days ahead of T20 World Cup
218.article_body: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batter Mushfiqur Rahim has announced his retirement from T20I cricket days ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Rahim, who scored five runs in T20 Asia Cup 2022, stated he wants to focus on Test and ODI cricket. Rahim tweeted, "I'll be available to play franchise leagues when...opportunity arrives. Looking forward to proudly represent my nation in the two formats."

219.title: Will object move to build houses on site of Noida twin towers: Residents
219.article_body: Residents of Emerald Court housing society stated they would object to attempts of Supertech to construct another housing tower on the spot of the demolished twin towers and move the court if needed. The nearly 100-metre-tall towers were demolished on August 28 following Supreme Court's landmark order which found construction in violation of norms. Supertech incurred estimated ₹500 crore loss.

220.title: Assam CM shows progress in education sector in video, tags Kejriwal
220.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday shared a video highlighting the state's progress in the education sector. Tagging Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the Twitter post, he said, "Unless forced to, we prefer to work quietly!" This comes days after Kejriwal shared a news report which said 34 schools in Assam were closed due to poor results in exams.

221.title: AAP MLAs attend parents-teachers meetings in Ludhiana govt schools
221.article_body: AAP MLAs attended parents-teachers meetings held in government schools in their respective constituencies in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday. The MLAs, like Sarvjit Kaur Manuke, Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina, etc, interacted with the students, teachers and parents to check the quality of education being provided there. Moreover, the MLAs called the teachers "nation builders".

222.title: She bounced back in 10 months: Zerodha Co-founder on pic with wife after cancer diagnosis
222.article_body: Sharing an update on his wife's cancer recovery journey, Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath posted a photo of them rock climbing. He wrote, "Seema has bounced back in just 10 months since her breast cancer diagnosis, the mastectomy, chemotherapy, and radiation, thanks to her healthy lifestyle before and after." Seema Patil was diagnosed with breast cancer in November.

223.title: CPI(M) leaders meet T'gana CM KCR, extend support to fight against hatred
223.article_body: Members of Communist Party of India (Marxist) met Telangana CM KCR and extended their support in fight against the forces of religious hatred. “The CM also thanked the CPI(M) party for coming forward in response to his call to unite the democratic supporters, intellectuals and political leaders representing the civil society to prevent the conspiracies of divisive forces,” CMO said.

224.title: Germany pledges $199 million for internally displaced Ukrainians: Report
224.article_body: German Development Minister Svenja Schulze has said that the government will provide Ukraine with $199 million to assist internally displaced people, reports said. "The money...intends to...ensure that the displaced people in Ukraine can...provide themselves with the most basic necessities," she added. Around 7 million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine since the war began.

225.title: We'll keep raising voices against inflation, king will have to listen: Rahul
225.article_body: Ahead of Congress’ 'Mehangai par halla bol’ rally in Delhi on Sunday, party leader Rahul Gandhi said the public today has to think ten times before buying essential things. "Only PM is responsible for these problems," Rahul tweeted. Furthermore, he said that his party will keep raising voices against inflation. "The king will have to listen," Rahul added.

226.title: Zuckerberg shares video of him training with MMA fighter Khai Wu, people react
226.article_body: Meta's billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Instagram to share a video of him training with MMA fighter Khai Wu ahead of the 27-year-old's UFC Fight Pass debut. Conor McGregor reacted saying, "Yo!!! F****** awesome Mark!", while a creator asked, "Can I unlock these skills in metaverse?" Another user wrote, "[Wu] does not wanna hit Zuck and lose his account."

227.title: BJP MP’s action at Deoghar airport equivalent to a terrorist act: Congress
227.article_body: Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi criticised BJP MP Nishikant Dubey over Deoghar airport incident and compared it to a terrorist act. “The way Dubey created ruckus in ATC is equal to a terrorist act...An MP should have followed the law but he is flouting it openly. Strict action should be taken against the MPs involved in it,” said Imran.

228.title: Amit Shah to visit Mumbai for Ganeshotsav today, traffic police issues advisory
228.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will be visiting Mumbai for Ganeshotsav, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said. Shah is expected to visit Lalbaugcha Raja pandal, another BJP leader said. Meanwhile, the Mumbai Traffic Police issued an advisory stating that traffic movement will be slow at some places on 4th and 5th of September due to VVIP visit in the city.

229.title: Why are thousands of Czech people from far-right & far-left protesting against govt?
229.article_body: Almost 70,000 people from the far-right and far-left protested against the Czech government in Prague on Saturday. The protest highlighted rising inflation and rise in energy prices amid Russia-Ukraine war. The protesters said the Czech Republic should be neutral and condemned the government for supporting sanctions against Russia, accusing it of being unable to cope with soaring energy prices.

230.title: Redemption for Afghanistan getting us out for 105: Bhanuka on SL's win
230.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said his team wanted to show the "entire world" during their four-wicket win against Afghanistan, that they're "not as bad" as they seemed when bowled out for 105 earlier against Afghanistan. "It was...redemption," added Bhanuka. Afghanistan batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history during the match, following his 84(45).

231.title: MobiKwik reports ₹540 crore revenue in FY22, registers 80% growth
231.article_body: Fintech startup MobiKwik has reported a revenue of ₹540 crore for FY22, registering an 80% year-on-year growth over the previous financial year. The firm's contribution margin rose to ₹147 crore from ₹40 crore reported in FY21. The payments platform of the fintech startup added 2.2 crore users, taking the total number of users to around 12.7 crore.

232.title: HC dismissed plea challenging support to wife, says man's duty to provide
232.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court dismissed a man's plea seeking quashing of a Family Court order granting interim maintenance of ₹3,000 per month to his wife. Citing a Supreme Court judgment, the court held "woman has right of same living standard which she [enjoyed] while living with...husband." HC stated husband is legally and morally responsible to look after his wife.

233.title: Today's rally has nothing to do with state polls or 2024 election: Cong's Jairam
233.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally that will be held in the national capital on Sunday, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said, "Today's halla bol rally has nothing to do with state elections or 2024 election." He added, "It’s a befitting message to insensitive central government as people of country remain troubled by inflation...unemployment."

234.title: Brahmastra makers lose ₹1.5 crore after event gets cancelled in Hyderabad: Report
234.article_body: A pre-release event for upcoming film Brahmastra with Jr NTR as the chief guest was cancelled at the last minute in Hyderabad after police permission for the event was denied, according to reports. The makers reportedly incurred a loss of ₹1.5 crore due to the cancellation. The film is slated to release on September 9.

235.title: EV charging points made mandatory for new buildings in Pune
235.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has made it mandatory for new buildings in the city to have charging facilities for electric vehicles (EVs). As per the new order, 20 percent of the total parking spaces should be reserved for electric vehicles in all commercial as well as residential buildings that have parking space for 20 or more four-wheelers.

236.title: Story of IITs is story of Independent India: President Droupadi Murmu
236.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that in more than one way, the story of the IITs is the story of Independent India. Speaking at the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of IIT Delhi on Saturday, the President said, "IITs have been pride of the nation...IITs proved to the world the capability of India in the domains of education and technology."

237.title: 26-yr-old baggage handler dies after her hair gets stuck in conveyor belt at US airport
237.article_body: A 26-year-old baggage handler at the New Orleans International Airport in the US died after her hair got caught in a conveyer belt recently. The baggage handler was unloading bags from a Frontier Airlines flight on the tarmac when the incident took place, officials said. She was rushed to a hospital but died due to her injuries.

238.title: IMD issues yellow alert for 10 districts of Himachal Pradesh
238.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for 10 districts of Himachal Pradesh till Sunday. The districts include Bilaspur, Hamirpur, Shimla, Kangra, Mandi and Kullu. The IMD has also warned of heavy rains and flash floods in the state. On Friday, several houses and shops were destroyed in Dharamshala following a cloudburst.

239.title: UK billionaire says WFH employees are 'lazy gits' who should be 'paid less'
239.article_body: British billionaire Alan Sugar was criticised after he remarked that work-from-home employees should be "paid less" as they save travel costs. Commenting after a discussion on a talk show, the 75-year-old also described remote workers as "lazy gits" who watch "golf and tennis" at home instead of working. "Get them back to the office or fire them," said Sugar.

240.title: KTR says Hyd's Gandipet park is ready for inauguration, shares pics
240.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday tweeted, "Gandipet park development by Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority is ready for inauguration." He also shared pictures of the same, saying that the park will be a "nice [and] new addition to greening the beautiful city of Hyderabad". He added that the park will have an amphitheatre.

241.title: It's a big burden, we have 1.1 million Rohingyas: Bangladesh PM
241.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina in an interview told ANI that the country has 1.1 million Rohingya migrants and it is a "big burden". She said that the country is consulting with the international community and its neighbouring countries so that the Rohingyas can go back home. "India as a neighbour country...can play a big role [in] it," she added.

242.title: Will hand over ₹15 lakh cash prize to parents: Superstar Singer 2 winner
242.article_body: Mohammad Faiz, who was named the winner of 'Superstar Singer 2', has said that he is "grateful" for the love and fame he received through this show. Speaking about the ₹15 lakh cash prize he received along with the trophy, the 14-year-old said, "I will hand it over to my parents because I participated in the show for them only."

243.title: Disagree with Akram's remark that Rizwan should've got out vs HK: Inzamam
243.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he disagrees with ex-Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram's remark that Muhammad Rizwan should have got "out", rather than remaining unbeaten during his 78 against Hong Kong. "Rizwan going not out...was a big no-no. If you're there, try to hit a couple of fours, get out...What's the point in this format going not out," Akram had said.

244.title: Meeting & talking to people from political parties doesn't change one's DNA: Azad
244.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from Congress, on Saturday said meeting people from other political parties and talking to them does not change the DNA of a person. "MPs from 22 parties spoke about me (on my farewell) but only what the PM said was highlighted," Azad added. Earlier, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said, "GNA's (Azad) DNA has been 'Modi-fied'."

245.title: Bengaluru police arrest car and sandalwood thieves, recover 9 cars
245.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested nine people in two cases related to car and sandalwood theft. Police seized 147 litres of sandalwood oil and 730 kilograms of sandalwood worth ₹3 crore. The police also got hold of a duo who operate across Delhi and Bengaluru. They recovered nine cars which included luxury models valued at around ₹1.2 crore.

246.title: Moody's is irrelevant: Musk after agency downgrades Tesla's credit rating
246.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk remarked on Twitter that "Moody's is irrelevant." Musk's tweet came in response to a Twitter user who shared a screenshot of an email that detailed the reasons for downgrading Tesla's credit rating. In the email, Moody's analyst Rene Lipsch clarified that the reasons for Tesla's rating are more qualitative rather than quantitative in nature.

247.title: FM lowering her level: T'gana minister on Sitharaman's demand for PM's pic
247.article_body: Telangana Health Minister Harish Rao criticised Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman after she scolded a Collector over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's photos at fair price shops. "I don't understand why the Union Minister keeps degrading her level. When she is talking about PM photos not being there…she is bringing down the Prime Minister's level," Rao said.

248.title: India's 1st 'Night Sky Sanctuary' to be set up in Ladakh in next 3 months: Govt
248.article_body: The Department of Science & Technology (DST) has undertaken to set up India's first-ever 'Night Sky Sanctuary' in Ladakh which will be completed within the next three months. The proposed Dark Sky Reserve will be located in Ladakh's Hanle. It will boost astro-tourism in India and will be one of the world's highest-located sites for optical, infrared and gamma-ray telescopes.

249.title: I get messages like 'You don't look old', sometimes I get 'Act your age': Sophie
249.article_body: Speaking about ageism, actress Sophie Choudry stated she gets messages where people tell her they were in school when her music video 'Ek Pardesi' came out and they look old but she doesn't. "Once in a while, I get messages...telling me to 'act my age' but what's that?" she added. Sophie said she never thought of age as a number.

250.title: We're not in 'Woods' anymore, films will now be Indian cinema: Johar
250.article_body: During a promotional event for the film 'Brahmastra', filmmaker Karan Johar said, "We keep giving it (films) 'wood', Tollywood, Bollywood. But we are not up in the woods anymore." He added that they are now out of the 'woods' and are proudly part of Indian cinema. "Each and every film will now be from Indian cinema," Johar further stated.

251.title: India only play in Dubai, are they afraid of Sharjah?: Ex-Pak bowler Bakht
251.article_body: Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht said India "only play" in Dubai, going on to question if they're "afraid" of playing in Sharjah. "India were scheduled to play against Pakistan in Sharjah. You guys changed it to Dubai," added Bakht. "That ground's been pretty bad for us...We're in strong favours with...ICC, so we're not playing there," jokingly reacted ex-India cricketer Atul Wassan.

252.title: Alleged Al-Qaeda member arrested in Mumbai's Bandra
252.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad and the West Bengal Special Task Force (STF) arrested a person from Bandra East for suspected terror links. The accused has been identified as Saddam Hussain Khan and is suspected to be a member of Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). He is accused of radicalising young men and recruiting for the terror outfit.

253.title: Delhi Police share traffic advisory in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally
253.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have shared advisory for commuters in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally that will be held in the national capital today. Ranjit Singh Flyover from Barakhamba Road to Guru Nanak Chowk, Vivekanand Marg, JLN Marg (Delhi Gate to Guru Nanak Chowk), roundabout Kamla Market to Guru Nanak Chowk and Chaman Lal Marg will remain closed.

254.title: Hyderabad's Cyberabad sub-inspector jailed for 2 yrs for taking bribe
254.article_body: The First Additional Special Judge for SPE & ACB cases convicted a sub-inspector posted in Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police Station to two years of imprisonment and imposed a fine of ₹5,000 for accepting bribe. The accused K Rajendra was trapped by Anti Corruption Bureau while demanding and accepting a bribe of ₹10,000 from complainant for releasing motor vehicle detained by him.

255.title: One of the world's oldest zoos in Bristol shuts down after 186 years
255.article_body: Bristol Zoo Gardens, one of the world's oldest zoos, welcomed visitors for the last time on Saturday as it shut down after 186 years. The zoo claims to have welcomed 9 crore visitors since it opened in 1836 and helped save 175 species from extinction. Notably, the zoo was home to the first-ever rare black rhino born in the UK.

256.title: Javed Akhtar may be communist but wrote bhajans in Lagaan in pure Hindi: Vivek
256.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about lyricist Javed Akhtar, has said, "Even a man like Javed, the bhajans he wrote for 'Lagaan' were pure Hindi." He further called Javed "well-read, intelligent" and a person who is tied to Indian roots. "He may be a communist, he may fight against the right-wing, it doesn't matter," Vivek concluded.

257.title: Man out on bail throws acid on woman in UP; woman escapes unhurt
257.article_body: A female 'lekhpal', a revenue official, escaped unhurt after a 30-year-old man threw acid on her in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, police said on Friday. The accused, who's on the run, had previously assaulted the official a year ago and was out on bail in the case, police added. The official was on her way to work when the incident occurred.

258.title: 2 arrested for 'hookah, non-veg boat party' on river Ganga in Uttar Pradesh
258.article_body: Two of eight youths who were seen smoking hookah and roasting meat on boats over Ganga river in Daraganj area of Uttar Pradesh were arrested on Saturday. The youths have been identified as 25-year-old Mohd Asif and 30-year-old Hassan Ahmad. "They are...being questioned so as to identify other six youths who were with them during the boat ride," police said.

259.title: UP preferred destination for investors due to improved law & order: CM Yogi
259.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said that Uttar Pradesh has become the preferred destination for investors because of improved law and order which has changed UP’s earlier image. "No riots took place in the last five-and-a-half years. The state is receiving huge investments and employment opportunities are being generated," CM Yogi added.

260.title: Barack Obama wins Emmy for narration in 'Our Great National Parks' documentary
260.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama was awarded an Emmy for narrating in Netflix documentary series 'Our Great National Parks', the Television Academy announced. "The 44th US President is now an Emmy winner for Outstanding Narrator," the Television Academy tweeted. Obama had already won Grammy Awards for audio versions of his memoirs 'The Audacity of Hope' and 'Dreams from My Father'.

261.title: Pakistani terrorist captured days ago dies of cardiac arrest in J&K
261.article_body: A Pakistani terrorist who was captured during an infiltration attempt about a fortnight ago died of cardiac arrest in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Saturday, said officials. A trained Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist, 32-year-old Tabarak Hussain underwent surgery at a military hospital after he was critically injured by the Indian Army, according to officials.

262.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rainfall and thunderstorms; people share pics, videos
262.article_body: Mumbai, on Sunday, witnessed heavy rainfall and thunderstorms. Several residents of the city took to Twitter to share pictures and videos of the weather. "Another round of crazy thunderstorms going on...since 7:30 am," one user wrote. Meanwhile, another wrote, "Sounds like thor is coming [to] Mumbai." "Can't get lovelier than this," a twitter user wrote while sharing a video.

263.title: 20-yr-old Rahmanullah smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
263.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

264.title: Insurance agents in Mumbai booked for cheating 1,129 policyholders
264.article_body: Tata AIG General Insurance company filed a police complaint in Mumbai against a group of more than 10 insurance agents for cheating 1,129 policyholders of the company and causing a loss of ₹1.53 crore to the company. The accused would collect the four-wheelers' insurance premium from policy buyers and deposit the two-wheelers' premium with the insurance company, the police said.

265.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
265.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

266.title: India reports 6,809 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 2.12%
266.article_body: India has reported 6,809 new COVID-19 cases and 21 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, five reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 7,219 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 55,114, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.12%.

267.title: Don't use unacceptable language against Mamata: TMC MP to Opposition
267.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy has warned Opposition leaders against using "unacceptable language" against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "If you (Opposition) call Mamata Banerjee the queen of thieves, be ready for a hard blow on your back," said Roy. "If you call her the queen of corruption, you never know how our party workers will react in anger," he added.

268.title: 1 dead on Kinnaur-Chitkul trek, search ops ordered for 5 missing people
268.article_body: One person died while five others went missing while they were on the Kinnaur-Chitkul trek. The five missing people include two trekkers and three porters. They were reportedly trekking from Khimloga Pass in Uttarakhand towards Himachal. The Disaster Management Authority of Himachal Pradesh has ordered a search and rescue operation for the missing trekkers and porters.

269.title: India set to become the 3rd largest economy in world by 2029: SBI report
269.article_body: The Indian economy is set to become the third largest economy in the world by 2029, an SBI research report has found. India is currently the world's fifth largest economy after overtaking the UK. According to the SBI report, India is on pace to pip Germany in 2027 and Japan by 2029, at its current rate of growth.

270.title: Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein owner announces plan to fire 10% staff globally
270.article_body: PVH Corp, the owner of brands like Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, has announced job cuts. The company said it planned "to reduce people costs in its global offices by approximately 10%" by the end of the next year to streamline the organisation and improve efficiency. It also said that it expected a revenue decline this year.

271.title: BJP won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming national party: Lalan Singh
271.article_body: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh said whatever "tricks" the BJP may play, it won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming a national party by 2023. "The BJP should worry about itself...They should think of their fate in 2024 when the entire Opposition will stand united against them," Singh added. His statement came after five JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in Manipur.

272.title: ₹2.3-crore Bentley car stolen from London found during raid in Pakistan; pic viral
272.article_body: Bentley Mulsanne, which was allegedly stolen from the UK's London, was recovered during a raid conducted by the customs department in Pakistan's Karachi. People involved in the whole racket managed to import the car to Pakistan using documents of a top diplomat of an east European country, according to reports. The vehicle costs more than $300,000 (around ₹2.3 crore).

273.title: Layoffs a chance to prove haters wrong, says Snap CEO amid 20% job cuts: Report
273.article_body: In a meeting held with employees after he confirmed 20% job cuts, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel reportedly said that while this was a setback, it was a chance to "prove the haters wrong". Some employees said that the alleged statement didn't help the meeting's tone and mood. Snap is laying off around 1,200 employees to reduce costs amid weak revenue.

274.title: 'Brahmāstra' sells over 27,000 tickets via advance booking: Report
274.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' has sold over 27,000 tickets at three national chains through advance booking within 24 hours, reported Pinkvilla. The film has sold more tickets through advance booking than the Hindi version of SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', the report added. 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' will mark Ranbir and Alia's first film together.

275.title: Japan 'declares war' on floppy discs, plans to phase out retro tech
275.article_body: Japan's Digital Minister Taro Kono has "declared a war" on floppy discs and other retro technology used in the country and is looking to phase them out. Around 1,900 government procedures still require businesses to use floppy discs, CDs and mini-discs, the Minister noted. At a recent conference, he asked, "Where does one even buy a floppy disc these days?"

276.title: Excited to be working with Kartik Aaryan again: Kiara on 'SatyaPrem...'
276.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani opened up about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in the film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' after the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I'm excited to be working with him once again! It's a love story, my favourite genre, where I play Katha, and he plays Satya," she stated. "Fortunately, our pairing...worked well in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'," she added.

277.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
277.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

278.title: My films aren't working as Kapil Sharma jinxes it, jokes Akshay Kumar
278.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar appeared in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film 'Cuttputlli' along with Rakul Preet Singh. In the promo of the episode, Kapil asked him, "Brother, how do you turn a year younger on every birthday?" To this, Akshay jokingly replied, "Kapil jinxes everything I do, my films, my money...now none of my films are working."

279.title: Congress vanishing from country, world getting rid of communist parties: Shah
279.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the Congress is vanishing from the country and the world is getting rid of communist parties. "If Kerala has a future, it's BJP. The [PM] Modi regime can bring much-needed change in the state," Shah added. "The Congress party and Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah stated.

280.title: Man who cheated woman on promise of marriage held: Rachakonda Police
280.article_body: Cybercrime police have arrested a 31-year-old man who allegedly cheated a woman of about ₹7.13 lakh after offering to marry her, Rachakonda Police tweeted on Sunday. In 2021, the accused asked for money by claiming various issues and later when the woman asked about marriage, he stopped responding to her calls. The accused and the woman had met in 2016.

281.title: Ex-SC judge says 'If I say I don’t like PM's face, somebody might arrest me'; Rijiju replies
281.article_body: A former Supreme Court judge, Justice B N Srikrishna, has said that if he were to say publicly that he doesn't like the PM's face, somebody might raid him or arrest him. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju responded, "Those people who speak all the time without any restrictions to abuse the popularly elected Prime Minister are crying about freedom of expression!"

282.title: Bhartaul becomes 1st village in UP to have RO water in every home
282.article_body: As part of the Adarsh Gram Panchayat initiative, Bhartaul in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district reportedly became the first village in the state to have RO water in every household. Four RO plants have been set up in the village to make clean water accessible to everyone. "It will save people from water-borne diseases," said Jag Pravesh, Chief Development Officer, Bareilly.

283.title: Rahmanullah Gurbaz smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
283.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

284.title: BJP can be reduced to 50 seats in 2024 if Opposition unites: Nitish
284.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday said that the BJP could be confined to less than 50 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections if the Opposition parties set aside their differences and unite. He said he would visit Delhi to work for a larger Opposition alliance. This comes after five JD(U) MLAs in Manipur joined BJP.

285.title: Pune woman gets nose surgery as husband beats her for not decorating Ganpati
285.article_body: A 31-year-old woman in Pune had to undergo plastic surgery for her nose after her husband allegedly threatened her and beat her up with an iron rod for not decorating lord Ganesha idol amid the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival. The woman's mother-in-law was also involved in the incident. "We have registered...FIR against the man and his mother," police said.

286.title: Pune records 2nd hottest September day since 1996 with 34.4°C temperature
286.article_body: Pune, on Saturday, recorded its second hottest day in September since 1996. Reports said that 34.4 degrees Celsius day temperature was recorded in Pune on Saturday. “The temperature rise is due to sunlight at forenoon...day temperature over 33 degrees Celsius along with high moisture have resulted in general cloudy conditions during the afternoon and evening time,” an official said.

287.title: Railways to undertake 5-hr jumbo block between 2 Mumbai stations today
287.article_body: The Western Railway has announced that it will be holding a jumbo block of five hours on up and down slow lines between Santacruz and Goregaon stations today (September 4). The jumbo block will be in place from 10 am to 3 pm. The block is announced to carry out maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment.

288.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, 25 fire tenders bring it under control
288.article_body: A fire broke out in a tent godown located near Vishal Enclave of Rajouri Garden in Delhi. Fire Department officials said that the fire brigade was called at 1 am, following which, 25 fire tenders were rushed to the site. News agency ANI reported that it took one and a half hours for the fire to be brought under control.

289.title: Qatar to allow beer sales at FIFA World Cup matches 3 hours before kickoff: Report
289.article_body: Qatar will allow ticketed fans to buy alcoholic beer at FIFA World Cup matches starting three hours before kickoff and for one hour after the final whistle, Reuters reported. However, beer sales won't be allowed during matches, report added. Beer would be available for sale within ticketed perimeter surrounding each stadium, but not in stadium stands or concourse, report stated.

290.title: Telangana CM, TRS taking instructions from AIMIM: State BJP chief
290.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Saturday accused the ruling TRS of taking instructions from AIMIM over the celebration of Hyderabad Liberation Day. "After BJP decided to celebrate September 17 as 'Hyderabad Liberation Day', all parties responded," he said. "But when AIMIM demanded to celebrate 'National Integration Day'...the state government came forward to celebrate it," he added.

291.title: Karnataka logs 941 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
291.article_body: Karnataka on Saturday reported 941 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, as per the state health department. The active caseload in the state stood at 5,203, the daily COVID-19 bulletin said. Bengaluru Urban district recorded 526 cases, the maximum among districts. Bidar, Gadag and Yadgir districts did not report any fresh COVID-19 cases or deaths.

292.title: 4 people shot at on Rohtak university campus over ₹6 lakh debt
292.article_body: Four people, including two students, were shot at by three men over a monetary dispute in Rohtak's Maharshi Dayanand University on Saturday, police said. The incident took place shortly after Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya left the campus following an inaugural event. A complainant said that a man, who owed him ₹6.40 lakh, and his aides opened fire on the campus.

293.title: Michael Schumacher in the best of hands: Former Ferrari F1 boss
293.article_body: Former Ferrari F1 boss Jean Todt said seven-time World Champion Michael Schumacher "is in the best of hands" as he recovers from severe brain injuries due to a 2013 skiing accident. "People ask so much about Michael...(he is) surrounded by people who love him...we are in constant contact," said Todt. The F1 legend is recuperating at his home in Switzerland.

294.title: Few athletes have inspired more people: Barack Obama on Serena Williams
294.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama congratulated tennis player Serena Williams on her career after the 40-year-old athlete retired from the sport on Friday. "Congratulations, Serena, for your heart, skill, intelligence, dedication, and grace," Obama tweeted. He added, "Few athletes have inspired more people both in and beyond their sport!" Williams has won 23 Grand Slam singles titles in her career.

295.title: Labourer killed in wall collapse in Delhi's Mustafabad, 2 injured
295.article_body: A labourer was killed after a wall collapsed at a construction site in northeast Delhi's Mustafabad area on Saturday, police said. The deceased was identified as 25-year-old Manoj Kumar. Two others were injured in the incident. The injured have been admitted to the Jag Pravesh Chandra Hospital, the police informed.

296.title: 25 lakh households received zero electricity bills: Punjab Minister
296.article_body: Punjab Power Minister Harbhajan Singh on Saturday said the AAP government in Punjab has fulfilled its promise of providing 300 units of free electricity per month. He added that 25 lakh households have received zero electricity bills. This was the first time a government is fulfilling its election promises in the initial year itself, Singh claimed in a statement.

297.title: Bail application of seer Shivamurthy Murugha postponed to Monday
297.article_body: The application seeking anticipatory bail for Murugha Mutt seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru has been postponed to Monday by a district court in Karnataka. He had reportedly applied for bail on medical grounds. Earlier, he had been taken to hospital after complaining of chest pain. He has been accused of sexually assaulting two girls in a hostel run by the mutt.

298.title: Too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022: Dravid
298.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said it is too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022 after the all-rounder suffered a knee injury. "The World Cup is a fair way away, so we don't want to jump to any conclusions," said Dravid. Earlier, PTI had reported that Jadeja would need a "major knee surgery".

299.title: That was insane: Red Bull F1's Verstappen on taking pole in Dutch GP
299.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen took pole position at the 2022 F1 Dutch GP, beating Ferrari's Charles Leclerc by less than a tenth of a second. "Unbelievable...We had a difficult day...it was very close...that was insane," said Verstappen. Ferrari's Carlos Sainz came third, with Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in fourth after Red Bull's Sergio Perez spun out in the final corner.

300.title: No bowler in current Pakistan line-up can replace Shaheen Afridi: Rizwan
300.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said no bowler in the current line-up could replace injured Shaheen Afridi. "The way he [Shaheen] has performed in the last 1-2 years, no bowler can...fill his shoes," said Rizwan, adding that this was the opportunity to find the next Shaheen. Pakistan qualified for the Asia Cup Super Four after beating Hong Kong on Friday.

301.title: ONGC is being deliberately destroyed by PM Modi: Jairam Ramesh
301.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Narendra Modi for running ONGC without a regular CMD (Chairman and Managing Director) since April 2021. "ONGC was a crown jewel. Then...[PM Modi] forced ONGC to absorb GSPC (Gujarat State Petroleum Corporation), a scam-ridden company," Ramesh tweeted. He added, "[ONGC is] being deliberately destroyed so that one of the 'Humare Do' takes it over."

302.title: Explore joint solutions to water disputes: Amit Shah to south states
302.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has urged southern states to look for joint solutions to address water-sharing disputes. Shah was addressing the 30th southern Zonal Council Meet in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday. Inter-state water disputes in the south include the Krishna river water sharing dispute between Telangana and Andhra Pradesh and the Cauvery dispute between Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.

303.title: Vijay Deverakonda to return ₹6 crore to 'Liger' producers after film flops: Reports
303.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has planned to give back a large portion of his remuneration for 'Liger' to the producers to compensate for the film's box-office performance, as per reports. He will reportedly return more than ₹6 crore to the producers to reduce the burden of losses. 'Liger' was reportedly made on a budget of ₹100 crore.

304.title: There is an 'undeclared emergency' in the country: JD(U)
304.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday passed a resolution alleging that there is an "undeclared emergency" in the country. It also alleged that the BJP government is trying to silence the Opposition voices by misusing probe agencies. The party also claimed that minorities are being targeted in the country. The national executive meeting of JD(U) was held on Saturday.

305.title: 32-year-old man gets 20 years in prison for minor's rape in Odisha
305.article_body: A court in Odisha's Ganjam district on Saturday handed a 20-year prison sentence to a 32-year-old man for abducting and raping a 14-year-old girl in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹55,000 on the convict. The rape survivor was awarded a compensation of ₹6 lakh. The convict had sexually assaulted the teenager after kidnapping her from her home.

306.title: Karan Johar and Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry: Jr NTR
306.article_body: Actor Jr NTR, during the promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, said that Karan Johar and SS Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry. "Let us hope...Karan sir achieves yet another milestone with this movie," he added. Karan Johar is producing the upcoming film. Jr NTR further said he hopes "Brahmastra emerges as the Brahmastra of our Indian film industry".

307.title: World noted India's independent stance on Ukraine war: EAM Jaishankar
307.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine war was "noted" by the world. Speaking at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, Jaishankar said when two countries are at war there is pressure on third parties to carefully choose sides. "The fact that we have taken an independent stance...that the world has noted," he said.

308.title: India's first female racing champion Alisha Abdullah joins BJP
308.article_body: Indian bike and car racing champion Alisha Abdullah joined the BJP in Chennai on Saturday. BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai was present in the event. "I am very happy to welcome a true sporting icon and fabulous competitive racer today," Annamalai said. Alisha is the country's first female national racing champion.

309.title: Tribal girl found hanging from tree in J'khand, mother alleges rape
309.article_body: A 14-year-old girl belonging to the tribal community was found hanging from a tree in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Saturday. The victim's mother has alleged that she was raped, killed and hanged from the tree on Friday. The minor was allegedly sexually exploited by a man on the pretext of marriage.

310.title: Armed groups clash in Libyan capital
310.article_body: Armed factions in Libya fought on the outskirts of Tripoli on early Saturday as groups close to Abdulhamid al-Dbeibah's government consolidated their position. The violence took place in Warshafala which has seen regular clashes in the last 11 years since a NATO-supported movement ousted veteran leader Muammar Gaddafi. Presently, Dbeibah's rival Fathi Bashagha has support in the country's east.

311.title: What is non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that has affected actress Jane Fonda?
311.article_body: Actress Jane Fonda has shared that she has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Non-Hodgkin lymphoma is a type of cancer that forms in the lymph system. It begins when a type of white blood cell, called a T cell or B cell, becomes abnormal. The signs and symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, drenching night sweats, weight loss and fatigue.

312.title: I almost died in that event: Serena on French Open 2015 win being her proudest achievement
312.article_body: On being asked about the proudest achievement of her career, Serena Williams said, "[Winning] French Open 2015." She added, "That's definitely the one that I'm taking with me because I almost died in that event. Somehow I won. So that was pretty awesome." Serena was suffering from flu during the tournament and played with a 101-degree fever in the semi-final.

313.title: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza criticises commentators for calling Maxwell's dismissal 'lucky'
313.article_body: After Zimbabwe defeated Australia by three wickets on Saturday to record their first-ever ODI victory against Australia in Australia, Zimbabwe batter Sikandar Raza criticised commentators for calling Glenn Maxwell's dismissal "lucky". "It was a lucky one, he knows how lucky it was," a commentator said. Sharing the video, Sikandar wrote, "How's this a lucky one...Please someone help me out here."

314.title: Thousands attend Gorbachev's farewell in Moscow; Putin absent
314.article_body: Thousands of mourners attended late former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev's farewell ceremony in Moscow on Saturday. Later, Gorbachev, who died at the age of 91 earlier in the week, was buried next to his wife Raisa at Novodevichy Cemetery. Putin was absent from the farewell and was said to be travelling to Russia's westernmost exclave, Kaliningrad on the day.

315.title: Sharmila never received criticism for Mansoor's underperformance: Mumtaz
315.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz reacted to the hatred that the wives and girlfriends of cricketers receive when they fail to perform on the field. She said her contemporaries Sharmila Tagore and Reena Roy never received criticism if Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi and Mohsin Khan underperformed. "Why are Bollywood actresses never praised when their cricketer-husband or boyfriends do well on...field?" said Mumtaz.

316.title: Deoghar DC charged with sedition on MP's complaint over airport row
316.article_body: A Zero FIR has been registered by Delhi Police against Deoghar Deputy Commissioner (DC) Manjunath Bhajantri on various charges including sedition on a complaint by BJP MP Nishikant Dubey. This comes after Dubey and nine others, including BJP MP Manoj Tiwari, were booked by Jharkhand Police for allegedly barging into Deoghar airport's air traffic control (ATC) room earlier this week.

317.title: Mahesh Babu's daughter makes 1st television appearance, actor pens note
317.article_body: Mahesh Babu on Saturday penned a note for his daughter Sitara on Instagram as she made her first television appearance. Mahesh and Sitara appeared together on 'Dance India Dance Telugu'. He wrote, "Sitara's first time on television...and our first appearance together...couldn't be more special! Watching her interact with everyone and dance...with such confidence...was a moment of pride for me!"

318.title: Obesity, psychological problems linked to excessive screen time: Study
318.article_body: Excessive screen time can cause obesity and psychological problems in people, a study stated. "Excessive exposure to blue light from...TVs, laptops and phones may have detrimental effects on a wide range of cells in our body, from skin and fat cells to sensory neurons," a researcher said. "[Avoiding]...excessive blue light exposure may be a good anti-ageing strategy," he added.

319.title: Rizwan going back not out was big no; what's the point of it in T20: Wasim
319.article_body: After Pakistani opener Muhammad Rizwan scored 78*(57) against Hong Kong, former pacer Wasim Akram said that Rizwan "going back not out" to him "was a big no". "If you are tired, try to hit boundaries and maybe get out and try and get fresh legs in the middle...What is the point in this format (T20) going not out," Akram asked.

320.title: EU well-prepared in case Russia ceases gas supply: EU official
320.article_body: The European Union is "well-prepared" to face the eventuality of a total halt in gas supply by Russia, thanks to storage capacity and energy-saving measures, EU's Economic Commissioner said on Saturday. Notably, Russian state-run gas company Gazprom on Friday announced that gas supply via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany would remain suspended indefinitely due to technical reasons.

321.title: Appalled by unruly conduct of FM Sitharaman with Collector: KTR
321.article_body: After Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's pictures at fair price shops, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said, "I am appalled by [Sitharaman's] unruly conduct." He also complimented Patil on his "dignified conduct", adding, "These political histrionics...will only demoralise hardworking AIS officers."

322.title: Govt school PTI booked for sexually harassing girl students in Rajasthan
322.article_body: A Physical Training Instructor (PTI) of Kendriya Vidyalaya school in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has been booked for sexual harassment and indecent behaviour with girl students. At least 12 girls aged between 15-17 years have alleged that the accused used to call them on phone and force them to have obscene talks with him. The girls had complained to the school management.

323.title: Iran says it has equipped 51 cities with civil defence systems
323.article_body: Iran's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that 51 cities in the country have been equipped with civil defence systems to prevent any possible foreign attacks. The systems enable authorities to "identify and monitor threats by using round-the-clock software, according to the type of the threat and risk", Deputy Defence Minister General Mahdi Farahi said, as per the local media.

324.title: Shah directs Ahmedabad civic body to solve garbage disposal issues in 3 days
324.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has directed the Amdavad Municipal Corporation (AMC) to resolve the issue of garbage disposal in the localities of Bopal, Ghuma and Ambli within three days. Shah has asked Municipal Commissioner Lochan Sehra to resolve the issue, which has emerged due to a strike by sanitation workers, BJP's Gujarat unit said.

325.title: 3 killed, 5 injured in lightning strike in MP's Singrauli
325.article_body: Three persons were killed and five others were injured due to a lightning strike on Saturday in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli, police said. Out of the five injured persons, the condition of two women was critical, an official said. The deceased were identified as 55-year-old Shyam Lal Kol, 52-year-old Meru Prasad Saket and 40-year-old Laxman Prasad Kol, Inspector Anil Upadhyay said.

326.title: Dynasty politics by Cong caused great loss to country: BJP leader
326.article_body: BJP leader Prakash Javadekar on Saturday criticised Congress and said the dynasty politics by the party has caused great loss to the country. "Look at our party, be it PM Modi and other leaders...from where did they come," Javadekar said at a programme in Jaipur. "They came from ordinary families with no political background, muscle or money power," he added.

327.title: Dravid avoids saying 'sexy' while answering during press conference, video goes viral
327.article_body: A video went viral showing India head coach Rahul Dravid avoiding saying the word 'sexy' during press conference. "I'm very confident that we've a very good bowling attack that produces results, might not be as, umm, I wanted to use a word but can't." After a journalist said if it is "exuberant", Dravid said, "No...It's four-letter word, starts with S."

328.title: NIA searches 16 locations in Assam in ULFA recruitment case
328.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday conducted searches at 16 locations in Assam in connection with the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) recruitment case and militant training in Myanmar. "Digital devices, live ammunition...incriminating documents and literature related to ULFA have been seized," the NIA stated. The investigations in the case are still in progress, NIA added.

329.title: Man hangs himself in Maha, mother jumps into well on seeing his body
329.article_body: A 26-year-old man named Shailesh Patil allegedly hanged himself from a tree near his house in Maharashtra's Palghar on Thursday. On seeing the son's dead body, his 40-year-old mother jumped into a well and ended her life, a police official said. The family conducted their last rites without informing police, the official said, adding that police are investigating the matter.

330.title: UK approves 2nd bivalent COVID-19 vaccine
330.article_body: Health authorities in the UK on Saturday approved the second "bivalent" vaccine which will be used as a booster dose to gain protection against the original strain of coronavirus and its Omicron variant. The jab can be given to individuals above 12 years of age. "Clinical trial...showed a strong immune response," said the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency.

331.title: 'Modi-Modi' chanted as Gehlot visits temple in Raj; BJP shares video
331.article_body: A group of devotees chanted "Modi-Modi" as Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot visited a temple in Jaisalmer on Friday. Sharing a video of the incident, BJP state President Satish Poonia called it "trends for 2023 and 2024 elections". "Devotees were expressing their choice by raising slogans…Gehlot…was accepting the greetings by shaking hands," minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat tweeted.

332.title: Rolls of Congress' internal elections not to be made public
332.article_body: Congress' Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Saturday said electoral rolls to elect the party's next president would not be made public. "No question of making it public," Mistry said. Earlier in the week, senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Pradyut Bordoloi and Karti Chidambaram said making the rolls public would ensure transparency.

333.title: 25-yr-old transgender man dies after attack in German pride parade
333.article_body: A 25-year-old transgender man has died after he was attacked at an LGBT+ Pride event in the west German city of Münster last week, police said. The news of Malte C's death triggered outrage with politicians and LGBT+ rights advocates demanding action. Reportedly, Malte was protecting a group of women from an attacker at the parade when he sustained injuries.

334.title: Teesta Setalvad walks out of prison a day after SC grants her bail
334.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad walked out of Sabarmati Central Jail in Ahmedabad a day after the Supreme Court granted her interim bail in a case related to the 2002 Gujarat riots. Setalvad has been in jail since June 26 for allegedly fabricating evidence related to the riots. She has been let out on bail after furnishing a personal bond of ₹25,000.

335.title: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon rocket launch postponed again due to fuel leak
335.article_body: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon mission has been postponed again ahead of the rescheduled launch today. "Teams attempted to fix an issue related to a leak in the hardware transferring fuel into the rocket, but were unsuccessful," NASA stated. Earlier, its first launch attempt was called off on August 29 due to an issue with an engine bleed.

336.title: Detergent allegedly used to cook mid-day meal in WB's Dinajpur
336.article_body: Several students of a school in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur reportedly fell ill and started vomiting after eating the mid-day meal on Friday. Local authorities said their investigation found that detergent or powdered soap was mixed with the meal instead of salt, leading to the incident. Protesting parents reportedly locked the headmaster and teachers inside an office.

337.title: School principal kidnapped in Maharashtra; ₹30 lakh ransom sought
337.article_body: A 50-year-old school principal was allegedly kidnapped by unidentified persons in Maharashtra's Nagpur, who have demanded ₹30 lakh ransom for his release, police said on Saturday. His two-wheeler vehicle was found parked in front of a hospital, an officer said. Police have registered a case in this connection and have formed several teams to trace the victim.

338.title: Pak are laying a foundation too deep; unnecessary in T20s: Sanjay
338.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar commented on the middle order of the Pakistan T20 side in the ongoing Asia Cup. "They (Pakistan) are laying too deep a foundation. For a 20-over innings, it's unnecessary," Manjrekar said. He added, "What's more it...[needs to] give more opportunity to number four, five [and] six, thereby making Pakistan a more wholesome batting unit."

339.title: 48-year-old IVRI employee dies while dancing at birthday party in UP, video surfaces
339.article_body: Prabhat Kumar, a 48-year-old man working at Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI) in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, died while dancing at a birthday party. A video has surfaced on social media showing Prabhat performing a solo dance and suddenly collapsing mid-way. He was then rushed to a hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. He reportedly suffered a severe heart attack.

340.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
340.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over some parts of Karnataka and Kerala on September 6 and 7. It is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on September 6. Parts of Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim and Uttarakhand may witness very heavy rainfall tomorrow.

341.title: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum ties the knot with actor Danny Sura, shares pics
341.article_body: Actress Ahmareen Anjum, who played a character named Loki in Rajamouli's 'RRR', tied the knot with actor Danny Sura in Kolkata on August 20. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ahmareen shared a series of pictures from her wedding ceremony and wrote, "Fortunate to have found my soulmate...We seek your love [and] blessings as we embark on this new journey together!"

342.title: Opposition will unify for 2024 elections: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
342.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar called for Opposition's unity in 2024 elections and said there is a need to think about how BJP is allegedly poaching MLAs from other parties. "When we parted ways from the NDA, all our six Manipur MLAs came...and assured us they were with JDU," said Kumar. He further questioned the constitutionality of the alleged poaching.

343.title: Six debt-ridden farmers die by suicide within 24 hours in Vidarbha
343.article_body: Six debt-ridden farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region within a 24-hour period on Friday and Saturday. A state government body said the farmers' crops were ruined due to the unprecedented rains and they failed to get fresh loans to sow their fields. Vidarbha has seen the most farmer deaths by suicide in Maharashtra in the past two years.

344.title: Sitharaman scolds Collector over no pic of PM at ration shop in T'gana, video surfaces
344.article_body: A video shows Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman scolding Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil when he couldn't provide an answer to what the Centre and state's share was in the rice supplied through fair price shops. She also asked why PM Modi's picture was missing at a shop. "Our people will come and put up...PM's banner here," she told him.

345.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar can never become PM in his life: BJP MP Sushil Modi
345.article_body: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar can never become Prime Minister in his life. "Posters and hoardings don't make anyone the Prime Minister. If a leader only has 5-10 MPs from his party, how can he become...PM?" he said, adding Nitish broke alliance with NDA just to remain in news.

346.title: Johar touches Nagarjuna's feet at event, says 'Dad was a friend of Nag sir'
346.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, during a promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, touched the feet of Nagarjuna who also marked his presence along with Jr NTR and SS Rajamouli. "My father was a dear friend of Nag sir, and I feel that legacy of love continues," Johar said. He added that Nagarjuna was the "favourite person" on the sets of 'Brahmastra'.

347.title: We all knew you were the greatest: LeBron James on Serena Williams
347.article_body: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James termed 23-time Grand Slam Champion Serena Williams as "unbelievable", adding he can speak about her journey for "an hour". "We all knew you were the greatest...It's been an honour to watch...you conquer all the goals...you ever set out, to see you break records," stated James. "What...you have done for women...is unprecedented," he said.

348.title: 150-foot-wide asteroid to pass past the Earth today: NASA
348.article_body: A gigantic killer asteroid named 2022 QO31 is going to pass past the Earth on September 3, NASA said. The asteroid will pass from 5.3 million kilometres away from the Earth. However, if any last-minute deviation takes place, the 150-foot-wide asteroid can reach the Earth in two days. It is travelling at a speed of 30,420 kmph.

349.title: Ukraine's attempt to seize nuclear plant thwarted, claims Russia
349.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday claimed that its forces on Friday night thwarted the Ukrainian military's attempt to capture the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant.
