Over 250 troops of Ukraine's Navy attempted a landing on the coast of a lake near the plant, the ministry said. Russian forces foiled the attack with strikes from military helicopters and fighter jets, it added.

350.title: 6, including lady gang leader, charged under Gangster Act in UP
350.article_body: Six people, including a lady gang leader along with her husband, have been booked under the Gangster Act in Mainpuri, UP. The police had recently arrested members of a robbery gang, which was headed by the female accused, identified as Vineeta, police said. Vineeta used to travel on e-rickshaws and intoxicate fellow travellers before stealing their belongings, police added.

351.title: 11-yr-old boy killed as wall collapses in UP's Bareilly
351.article_body: An 11-year-old boy, identified as Gaurav Kumar, was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Saturday after a wall of his neighbour's house collapsed on him while he was playing, police said. Another boy was injured in the incident. Neighbours pulled the boys out of the debris and took them to a hospital where Gaurav was declared dead, the SP said.

352.title: Teacher, headmaster arrested for assaulting student in Rajasthan
352.article_body: A teacher and a headmaster of a private school in Rajasthan's Sikar have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a student. Police said the Class 12 student was allegedly slapped by his teacher for not following instructions to stand in line properly during a prayer meeting. Later, he was allegedly thrashed by both the accused, the victim's family claims.

353.title: If Kerala has a future, it's BJP: Amit Shah in Thiruvananthapuram
353.article_body: Addressing the southern zonal council meeting in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said if the state has a future, it's the BJP. "Congress is vanishing from the country, the world is getting rid of communist parties," Shah said. "Congress...and the Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah added.

354.title: Need to make educational institutions future ready: President Murmu
354.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday said there is a need to make educational institutions future ready with new teaching and learning metrics, pedagogy and content. Addressing the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, President Murmu called IITs the country's pride and said, "Their story is the story of independent India."

355.title: Afghanistan have all their bases covered, confidence is high: Jaffer
355.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Afghanistan team have "covered all their bases". "The [Afghanistan] batters are playing well, they have world-class spinners and the pacers have done well too," Jaffer said. He added, "So,...the confidence is high considering they defeated both their opponents [in the group stage]...Afghanistan is definitely the favourites to win [against Sri Lanka]."

356.title: British tourists charged ₹112 for using toilet at Agra railway station
356.article_body: Two British tourists were reportedly charged ₹112 each for using washroom in the executive lounge of the Agra Cantt railway station. The amount included 12% GST as well. As per reports, IRCTC clarified it's a mandatory fee charged by the executive lounge, after which a passenger can stay inside for two hours, use free wifi and also avail free coffee.

357.title: Minister came to hotel & stayed till 2 am, took voters to 1 floor: Bhutia on AIFF elections
357.article_body: After losing the AIFF elections to Kalyan Chaubey, ex-captain Bhaichung Bhutia said he was shocked as he didn't expect political interference of "high level". "If they (his opponents) were...confident...why a powerful Union Minister had to come at...hotel (where voters were staying)...and stay there till 2 am in...morning of election day...and take all of them to particular floor," Bhutia stated.

358.title: Dalit student hit with metal rod, broom for touching UP teacher's bike
358.article_body: A Class 6 Dalit student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was allegedly locked up in a classroom and beaten with a metal rod and a broom by his teacher for touching the latter's motorcycle, police said on Saturday. The other staff of the school rescued the boy, police added. According to a Basic Shiksha Adhikari, the accused teacher has been suspended.

359.title: Ravindra Jadeja's knee injury serious, set to miss T20 World Cup 2022: Reports
359.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is set to miss T20 World Cup 2022 as he'll undergo a knee surgery, reports said. "Jadeja's right knee injury is pretty serious. He's supposed to undergo a major knee surgery and will be out of action for indefinite period of time," a senior BCCI official told PTI. The T20 WC 2022 will begin next month.

360.title: Lakhs of people to attend rally against price rise: Cong leader Venugopal
360.article_body: Talking about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress MP KC Venugopal said they're (Congress) set for a massive rally against price rise which will be attended by lakhs of people. "This agitation started 2021 onwards, we can proudly say we are the party that's fighting against price rise in the country," he said. The Yatra will take place from Kanyakumari to Srinagar.

361.title: Take steps to galvanise economy: Kerala CM to Centre
361.article_body: Speaking at the 30th southern zonal council meeting, chaired by Union Minister Amit Shah, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan urged the Centre to enable the states to "undertake productive spending to galvanise the national economy". "The fiscal empowerment of the Union and the states are of equal importance to meet the long impact of the pandemic on the economy," he said.

362.title: 18 killed in al-Shabaab attack in Somalia, food aid trucks burnt
362.article_body: At least 18 civilians were killed in an overnight attack by al-Shabaab militants in Somalia's central region, the country's state news agency reported on Saturday. The al-Shabaab fighters also burnt several trucks carrying food aid, the report added. According to media reports, "most of the people on board the vehicles (relief food trucks)" were killed in the attack.

363.title: 7 torch vehicles over complaint against Bengal headmaster; arrested
363.article_body: The West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested seven persons for torching vehicles and creating unrest in Purba Medinipur over a corruption complaint against a school headmaster, Nandakumar SHO Manoj Kumar Jhano said. Police personnel, who were attacked by students and locals when they tried to control the situation, had to resort to lathicharge to disperse the mob, the SHO added.

364.title: They see beauty in everything: Nawazuddin on female directors
364.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, while sharing his experience of working with female directors, said that women look at the world differently. He added that they are far more compassionate and see beauty in everything. Nawazuddin has worked with several female directors, including Nandita Das, Anusha Rizvi, Zoya Akhtar, Reema Kagti and Debamitra Biswal.

365.title: NGT orders Bengal to pay ₹3,500 crore for gap in waste management
365.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed a penalty of ₹3,500 crore on the West Bengal government for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Continuing damage is required to be prevented in the future and past damage is to be restored, the bench said. The penalty is to be paid within two months.

366.title: Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams: Woods on Serena
366.article_body: Talking about Serena Williams whose defeat against Ajla Tomljanovic in the US Open marked the last match of her career, golfer Tiger Woods tweeted, "Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams." "How lucky were we to...watch a young girl from Compton...become one of the greatest athletes of all time," tweeted former US First Lady Michelle Obama.

367.title: Cleric passing info on military to Pakistan arrested by J&K Police
367.article_body: J&K Police have, with inputs from Military Intelligence, arrested a local cleric from a mosque in Kishtwar for allegedly running a terror-cum-espionage module. Abdul Wahid was reportedly working for terror group Kashmir Janbaaz Force, which is being controlled by Pakistan. The 22-year-old cleric was allegedly passing information on military deployment and movement to his contact across the border.

368.title: Liquor sale banned in certain areas of Bengaluru during this weekend
368.article_body: In view of the Ganesh Chaturthi's idol immersion processions over this weekend, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city. The areas are located across three police divisions namely the eastern, north-eastern and northern divisions of Bengaluru. However, the dates of the prohibition order's implementation vary across areas.

369.title: Govt shares pics of 'future look' of New Delhi Railway Station, Twitter users react
369.article_body: Ministry of Railways shared photos of the proposed design of the to-be redeveloped New Delhi Railway Station. While some Twitter users appreciated the modern architecture, one comment read, "This looks great but seems like 2050 plan looking at the amount of land acquisition/development this requires." "Glass building in heat of...Delhi...Just wasting money," another comment read.

370.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha'
370.article_body: Director Sameer Vidwans' 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha', starring Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani, went on floors on Saturday. The actors took to their respective Instagram handles to share the news, writing, "Sattu Aur Katha. Love Story Begins Today." The film is a musical love story that brings Kartik and Kiara together for the second time after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

371.title: Hyd BJP Corporator arrested for allegedly kidnapping 22-yr-old man
371.article_body: Baddam Prem Maheshwar Reddy, BJP Corporator from Hyderabad's Gaddiannaram, was arrested on Saturday in connection with the alleged kidnapping of a 22-year-old man from PNT Colony. Earlier, police traced the man to Nalgonda and made three arrests. While interrogating the arrested men, police learnt that Reddy had pre-planned the kidnap and made arrangements for a car to abduct the man.

372.title: Tenure extension of St Stephen's principal illegal: DU
372.article_body: Delhi University (DU) has told St Stephen's College's Chairman, its Supreme Council and Governing Body that its Principal John Varghese is continuing illegally in the post since March 2021. DU said the college did not follow University Grants Commission regulations when extending his term. DU said it found the college's Supreme Council violating due processes and procedures.

373.title: 18-yr-old Gauff, 28-yr-old Garcia reach their maiden 4th round at US Open
373.article_body: US' Coco Gauff and France's Caroline Garcia entered the fourth round at the US Open for the first time in their career on Friday. The 18-year-old American, who is playing in her third US Open, beat compatriot Madison Keys 6-2, 6-3 in the third round, while the 28-year-old Frenchwoman defeated former champion Bianca Andreescu 6-3, 6-2.

374.title: Court issues contempt notice to Delhi Police Commissioner in rape case
374.article_body: A Delhi court has issued a contempt notice to Police Commissioner, Delhi, in an alleged gangrape case. The bench noted Sangam Vihar Police Station registered the FIR in the case after 36 days of the victim filing a complaint before the Station House Officer. The court said this "depicted a sordid and pathetic state of affairs" in Delhi Police's administration.

375.title: Pilot allegedly steals plane, threatens to crash it into US Walmart store; video surfaces
375.article_body: A pilot allegedly stole an aircraft and threatened to crash it into a Walmart store in US' Tupelo. The police evacuated the buildings and asked citizens to avoid the area. Several users on Twitter shared videos showing the plane flying in circles over homes and businesses. All emergency services in the area are on alert.

376.title: Class 2 boy mauled by 2 pitbulls in Bengaluru, his face disfigured
376.article_body: Two pitbulls reportedly attacked a Class 2 student for the second time in around seven months in Bengaluru. His father claimed that the dogs' owner, who lives in the same building as the seven-year-old boy, had provoked the dogs to attack the child during an argument. "My son's face has been disfigured...He needed 58 stitches...His condition is critical," he added.

377.title: Pune leading shift to alternative transport fuel: Fadnavis
377.article_body: The Maharashtra government is shifting public transport to alternate fuel and Pune is leading the change, Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said. "The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is leading the change with 650...electric buses, which implies that 30% of PMPML transportation is using alternative fuel," he said. Fadnavis spoke at an electric bus depot launch in Pune.

378.title: Delhi Police personnel assaulted in road rage incident
378.article_body: A Delhi Police head constable was allegedly assaulted by two motorcycle-borne men in Delhi's Vikaspuri area in a road rage incident on Thursday. According to police, the victim was travelling in his car when he was signalled to stop by a motorcycle rider. The biker and his pillion rider assaulted the victim after complaining about his driving, police said.

379.title: Bengaluru Police bust car stealing racket; 2 arrested
379.article_body: The Bengaluru Police have arrested two people for running a car stealing racket across Delhi and Bengaluru. The accused used to steal cars and then change their number plates and chassis numbers, police said. Nine cars worth around ₹1.2 crore have been recovered by the police. The DCP (Bengaluru Central Division) RS Gowda congratulated the team on their success.

380.title: Almost 100% Indians breathing polluted air: Report
380.article_body: Over 99% of India's population is breathing polluted air, a report by Greenpeace India stated on Friday. Most people living in India are exposed to PM2.5 concentrations, which is five times more than the annual average guideline prescribed by WHO. As per the report, most polluted region in India is Delhi-NCR, followed by Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and West Bengal.

381.title: Mumbai's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to get pod hotel
381.article_body: After Mumbai Central and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT), the railways is planning to bring a large-sized pod hotel at Kurla's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (LTT). "Pod hotels offer a comfortable and affordable overnight staying option to passengers at stations. At the Kurla LTT...it will be opened near the Passenger Reservation System (PRS) ticket counter," a railway official said.

382.title: Everyone in industry is saying 'bhakton ne barbad kar di': Vivek on 'Laal...'
382.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about failure of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "Everyone in...industry is saying 'bhakton ne film ko barbad kar diya (bhakts ruined the film)'." "But...how many votes PM Narendra Modi gets? 40% okay? So let's take this 40-50% away...Where are...rest of...people?" he said, adding people didn't watch the film because they didn't know what it was all about.

383.title: Indian men's hockey team is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Pro League: Surender
383.article_body: Indian men's hockey team defender Surender Kumar said his side is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Hockey Pro League matches against New Zealand and Spain, beginning October 28. "We've to work hard and correct our mistakes in the camp now so that the mistakes don't happen again," he added. India won a silver medal at CWG 2022 last month.

384.title: Want to develop Rajasthan as centre of religious tourism: CM Gehlot
384.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said his government wants to develop the state as a centre of religious tourism. "The state government is committed to providing the devotees all kinds of facilities and security," he said. "All religious places in the state should be beautiful and equipped with all facilities," CM Gehlot added.

385.title: 2 cab drivers abduct, rape 25-yr-old woman in Bengaluru; arrested
385.article_body: Two cab drivers were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly abducting and raping a 25-year-old woman on the pretext of dropping her to her destination, police said. The woman was reportedly walking on a road on Wednesday when she was approached by two bike-borne men, who took her to an isolated place and raped her. They also kept her in captivity.

386.title: Can't be a sentence less than life imprisonment for murder convict: SC
386.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said that there cannot be any sentence/punishment less than life imprisonment, if an accused is convicted of murder. Justices MR Shah and Krishna Murari made the statement while quashing the judgement of Madhya Pradesh High Court, which had reduced the sentence of a murder convict from life imprisonment to the sentence already undergone by him.

387.title: Axar is correct like-to-like replacement for Jadeja at Asia Cup: Irfan
387.article_body: Commenting on Ravindra Jadeja being replaced by Axar Patel in India's squad for remainder of Asia Cup 2022, Irfan Pathan said the all-rounder is the "absolutely correct like-to-like replacement". He added, "Only problem is that Jadeja had become such a fantastic batter that you could've batted him up the order, you might not be able to do that with Axar."

388.title: 3, including a woman, killed as bike collides with truck in UP
388.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were killed in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra on Saturday after the motorcycle they were travelling on collided head-on with a truck, police said. The deceased were identified as 25-year-old Majmuddin Ansari, 27-year-old Ishtiyak Ansari and 30-year-old Gulabi. The trio died on the spot, while the truck driver escaped after the accident, SHO Lakshman Parvat said.

389.title: Efforts being made to defame Rajasthan: Gehlot on NCRB report
389.article_body: After the report of National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) was released, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said efforts are being made to defame the state. It would be appropriate to compare the figures of 2019 and 2021 as there was a lockdown in 2020, Gehlot said. "Uttar Pradesh is ahead in...murder cases, crime against women and kidnapping," he added.

390.title: 20-yr-old man dies after speeding BMW sports car falls off Yamuna Expressway in Noida
390.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed while another was injured after a speeding BMW sports car spun out of control and fell off the Greater Noida Yamuna Expressway on Saturday morning. The incident happened near Galgotias University in Dankaur area. The accident took place at around 8.30 am when the two men, who hail from Haryana, were going towards Agra.

391.title: SC to hear plea on violence against doctors on Monday
391.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday will hear a plea seeking directions to ensure adequate security at hospitals and medical centres to deter attacks on doctors and healthcare workers, primarily by relatives of patients. The petition also seeks directions to Centre and states for the formation of a distress fund to grant compensation to victims of such violence or their families.

392.title: There's so much to learn from them: Mouni on co-stars Ranbir, Alia
392.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy in an interview said her 'Brahmastra' co-stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are very disciplined and amazing human beings. "There's so much to learn from the two of them," Mouni said, adding, "One thing I tell everybody, whenever I get asked about Ranbir-Alia, is that they are fire. They light up on screen."

393.title: Drug smuggling accused arrested by Odisha Police from Ghaziabad
393.article_body: The main accused in a drug smuggling case was arrested by a Special Task Force (STF) team of Odisha Police from Ghaziabad on Thursday. The arrest was in connection with the seizure of 202 grams of cocaine worth around ₹50 lakh from Bhubaneswar in April this year. The Odisha Police team was assisted by UP Police in making the arrest.

394.title: Ousted SL Prez gets official residence, security on return: Officials
394.article_body: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was provided with an official residence and security by the government after he returned home on Saturday after fleeing the country in July, officials said. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on July 13 following mass protests amid the economic crisis. He had resigned after arriving in Singapore on July 14 and later travelled to Thailand.

395.title: Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating Astraverse: Rajamouli on Brahmastra
395.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who was roped in to present Ayan Mukerji's directorial 'Brahmastra' in South, has said this kind of film needs to be supported. "When Ayan started narrating about these Astras to me, all my childhood fantasies came to life," he added. Rajamouli further said Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating 'Astraverse'.

396.title: Scindia urges states to lower VAT on aviation turbine fuel
396.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia urged states to reduce value-added tax (VAT) on aviation turbine fuel (ATF). He said only 16 of the 24 states had responded positively to this proposal, adding that ATF accounted for 40% of the airlines' cost structure. Scindia said currently only eight states are charging VAT at 20-30%, while 16 states charge 1-4% VAT rates.

397.title: He was always keen to take the ball: Rajkumar on Kohli's bowling
397.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's bowling, his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said the India batter was always confident as a bowler. "Morne Morkel did dent his confidence a bit in...past (laughs) but he was always keen to take the ball...used to say- 'give me the ball, I will pick wickets'," he added. Kohli posted 1-0-6-0 against Hong Kong at Asia Cup.

398.title: Ghana man swallows 87 cocaine capsules worth ₹13 cr, held in Mumbai
398.article_body: The Customs department arrested a passenger from Ghana at the Mumbai airport for trying to smuggle cocaine into India by hiding it in 87 capsules that he had swallowed. The Customs said 1,300 grams of cocaine valued at ₹13 crore was recovered. The accused was reportedly admitted to a state-run hospital, where he ejected those capsules over three days.

399.title: PM Modi writes letter to UAE President to strengthen strategic ties
399.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has written a letter to UAE President Sheikh Mohamed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan to talk about further strengthening strategic relations between the countries. PM Modi's letter was delivered by EAM S Jaishankar when he met the UAE President in Dubai. According to UAE's news agency, the letter also talks of developing strategic relations to serve common interests.

400.title: Pune's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate higher than state average
400.article_body: Pune district's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate is higher than the state average as fresh COVID-19 cases continue to fall. While the vaccine wastage rate in Maharashtra is 13.31%, the wastage rate in Pune district is 13.86%. In Pune district, only 1,054 Corbevax doses have been used as precaution, said State Immunisation Officer Dr Sachin Desai.
